forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southeast wind 14 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 18 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The night hovers over Downtown San Francisco, cloaked in a damp, cool embrace punctuated by the steady rhythm of rain—not the kind that whispers; rather, it’s a declaration of the season, with a determined downpour expected to stretch into the morning. The skies are draped in grey, muting the vibrant colors of city life, as the wind carries a restless spirit from the south, promising gusts that dance around rooftops and rattle windows. As you step outside, the chill clings uninvited, inviting layers of comfort—perhaps a well-loved sweater beneath a waterproof jacket, paired with sturdy footwear to navigate slick streets.

As the day unfolds, the clouds will not budge; they will linger, heavy, yielding to the persistent drizzle that may well intensify before it gently wanes. Visibility may be muted, with hints of the iconic Golden Gate Bridge shrouded in the marine layer’s haze, whispering to those who wait for a clearer horizon. For the mindful observer, today offers the perfect backdrop for a quiet coffee in a cozy café, a moment of solace while gazing out at the rhythmic dance of rain against the window, or perhaps a small museum visit away from the elements. With a determined heart and a splash of practicality, this day offers simple pleasures even amid the gloom—a reminder that beauty often thrives in the most unexpected moments.
